title: Asking for and Giving Directions
description: Practice asking for directions and describing locations.

sentences.text: Excuse me, how do I get to the train station?
Turn left at the traffic light.
sentences.tips: 'Turn left'를 한 덩어리로, 'traffic light'를 명확하게 발음하세요.

sentences.text: Is there a pharmacy near here?
sentences.tips: 끝을 올려서 의문문 억양을 살리고, 'pharmacy'의 강세는 첫 음절: PHAR-ma-cy.

sentences.text: It's on the corner, next to the bank.
The museum is opposite the park.
It's about a ten-minute walk from here.
Walk past the hospital and turn right.
You can't miss it. It's a big building.
I think I'm lost. Can you help me?
sentences.translation: 길을 잃은 것 같아요. 도와주실 수 있나요?
sentences.tips: 'lost'를 강조하고, 'Can you help me'는 부드럽게 요청하는 톤으로.

sentences.text: Is the subway station far from here?
Thank you so much for your help!
sentences.tips: 'Thank you so much'를 진심을 담아 감사하는 톤으로 말하세요.

lines.text: Excuse me, I'm looking for the National Museum.
Sure! Go straight for two blocks.
Turn left at the intersection. The museum is on your right.
No, it's about a 10-minute walk. You can't miss it!

items: Did you pronounce direction words clearly?
Did you use rising intonation for questions?
Did you use polite intonation when asking for help?
Did you speak at a natural pace?
Did you speak without long pauses?
Did you practice the dialogue smoothly?
Did you use prepositions of place correctly?
Did you use imperatives correctly for directions?
Did you follow the pronunciation tips?
Could a listener understand the directions?
Did you sound polite and friendly?
Were your directions clear and logical?
Did you record and compare all sentences?
